## AppBuilder.view() method

Set the view function.

**Signature:**

```typescript
view(fn: ViewFunction<State, Components>): AppBuilder<State, Components>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

fn


</td><td>

[ViewFunction](./dsl.viewfunction.md)<!-- -->&lt;State, Components&gt;


</td><td>

Function that returns a [ViewNode](./dsl.viewnode.md) tree


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[AppBuilder](./dsl.appbuilder.md)<!-- -->&lt;State, Components&gt;

A new [AppBuilder](./dsl.appbuilder.md) with the view function set

## Remarks

The view function is called on every render cycle and receives the current state and component views. It should return a [ViewNode](./dsl.viewnode.md) tree describing the UI to display.

## Example


```typescript
createApp()
  .view(({ state, components }) => vstack(
    text('Hello ' + state.name),
    components.spinner
  ))
```
